intro: Cycladenia humilis var. typica, commonly known as the smallflowered bellflower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It typically reaches heights of 10–20 centimeters and features slender stems covered in fine, hairy hairs. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue or violet, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, often with a slightly hairy surface. Cycladenia humilis var. typica thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
